thesis.description: Hemorrhagic necrosis involving the inner third of the left ventricle is seen in 50% of deaths post-cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB). It occurs almost exclusively in hypertrophied ventricles which fibrillate during CPB. The normal distribution of blood flow is epicardial (EPI) in systole and endocardial (ENDO) in diastole. The net result is an EPI/ENDO ratio of 0.8 (0.5 - 1.1). We propose that any imbalance between the driving forces and resistance in the heart may lead to a redistribution of blood flow which may jeopardize the viability of the endocardium.

thesis.title: Distribution of blood flow in the myocardium
